text: can we just start this interview by
getting you to respond to some of those
direct allegations from dr. Sudbury's
side um he spoke to us less than an hour
ago he said that the heart of all this
is Israel's racism towards the
Palestinians as well as denial of the
Palestinians right to exist and have a
cultural life in the holy city of
Jerusalem nothing could be further from
the truth
obviously we respect everyone from
different nationalities of different
faiths
I think only since the city became
reunited under Israeli control can one
say that all faiths are free to practice
their religion all the holy sites are
run and administered by their own
communities autonomously Israel is
committed to that so you would deny that
Israel is unilaterally widening access
to accommodate larger numbers of Jewish
worshippers if you're asking
specifically about the Temple Mount
Prime Minister Netanyahu has said
repeatedly that we will not allow any
changes to the status quo and the status
quo has served as a basis for
live-and-let-live for decades now and we
are committed to maintaining that and
the Prime Minister will oppose attempts
in Parliament in other places to change
the status quo very clear about that and
these concerns or these rumors that one
hears on the Palestinian side about some
sort of supposed threat to the Islamic
holy places it's completely baseless we
are committed to maintaining the status
quo so Margrave why the need then to
close the compound today given how
inflammatory that very action is we were
compelled to do it we didn't want to the
goal is to reduce friction to reduce
tension on what is ultimately a day
where there's been a murder in this is
concern about reprisals from different
sides so the idea is to try to calm
things down as quickly as possible and
therefore allow as soon as possible
everyone to get back to normal so people
of all faiths can can worship in freedom
and in safety the concern though is that
the exact opposite will happen
already heard Martin would a bar say
that this is tantamount to a declaration
of war I think unfortunately that sort
of language is exactly what we don't
need we need people to encourage peace
and quiet and live and let live you know
we've had some Islamic extremists to
talk about a so-called threat to the
Muslim holy places that doesn't exist
it's just not there but they they
fabricated this and it's very very of
concern I think that when when
mainstream Palestinian leadership echoes
that come to the holy places in
Jerusalem see for yourselves the theory
that they are thriving that they are
autonomously administered by the Muslim
religious community in itself there is
no it's all a fabrication but they would
say the wider picture of course comes
back to the occupation Mark Regev and
there are much bigger questions there
just a few days to go yet again it's
Rael announcing further expansion of
settlements that in itself is
inflammatory let alone what we saw in
Gaza over the summer with the issue of
drew of the settlements will be
determined ultimately in the peace talks
between us and the Palestinians what
Israel is talking about is planning new
housing units in Jewish neighborhoods of
Jerusalem and I'd remind you and all the
viewers that in every piece band plan
that's been put on the table in the last
20 years the Jewish neighborhoods of
Jerusalem remain part of Israel in final
status peace that's that's also
something the Palestinians have accepted
so I would ask you in the audience why
is it a problem for peace if Israel is
building in those very neighborhoods
where everyone is accepted that there's
an international consensus that those
neighborhoods remain part of Israel
